text: The tribe is gathered around the big fire pit. The tribe' SHAMAN, their medicine man and spirit leader, dances arou the fire in a boar's head mask, accessorized with way too many bones, beads and feathers. Zed and Oh are sitting near the fire, smoking something i long, decorated pipe.
Hey, Oh? Did it ever occur to you that there may be more to life than this?
(taking the pipe from Zed) Okay, I think somebody's had enough. Official White
No, thisworld, we hunt, we gather, we eat,we sleep, we make babies--
You make babies--
--but why? What's the point?
You always get like this when you smoke. Oh takes a big toke on the pipe, chokes, and starts cough uncontrollably.
No. Last night I couldn't sleep, so I just laid there looking up at the sky, counting the stars. There were over seventy. Kinda makes you think, doesn't it?
(looks up at the sky) No.
Really? I've been thinking about it ever since I ate that fruit. Don't you ever wonder what's on the other side of the mountains?
There's nothing on the other side of the mountains. Everybody knows that. The world just ends. You'd fall right off the edge. (makes a sharp gesture)
But what if it doesn't? What if it just goes on and on forever? Or what if it's round? (he picks up a round
And if you keep walking you eventually come right back to where you started? He traces the circumference with his finger. Official White
(SCOFFS)
Oh, yeah, that's plausible. Zed flings the rock away.
Oww!
(waves apologetically) Sorry!

(tries to cheer him up Will you stop with that crazy talk? We're at a feast. You love feasts. There's women, there's boar meat, there's an assortment of berries-- there's women-- Oh looks over at Eema. Zed picks up on it.
Do it, man! Go dance for her.
You think? They're playing the Jackal Dance. I don't do that one so well.

Are you kidding? Go! Jackal Dance! Oh summons his courage, gets up and crosses to where the girls are sitting. Zed makes subtle eye contact with Maya, waggles his eyebr and licks his lips. She laughs and looks away. Oh starts dancing timidly right in front of Eema, subtly jerking his pelvis, trying to be cool. Eema just stares at him for a moment, then goes back to talking to her friends. Oh looks over at Zed for help. Zed mimes clonking her on the head. Oh picks up a wooden club and hits Eema right on the nogg However, instead of submitting, she gets really pissed, stands up and decks him with one punch. Official White Eema glowers at Zed who feigns innocence.
6 6 A hunter is slicing off hunks of boar meat for the other tribesmen. Zed pushes through the small crowd waiting for food and goes to the front.
Excuse me, hunter coming through.
Hey! Wait your turn! There's a line here, buddy!

For your information I was in line and I just stepped out to chew some food for an elderly lady. Suddenly a SPEAR is thrust inches from his face, stopping him. It's Marlak, who towers over Zed. His cohort, ENMEBARAGESI, short and stout, stands beside him.
Enmebaragesi said he saw you in the garden with Maya.
Oh, really? And what if I called Enmebaragesi a liar?
I'd kill you.
Calm down. I said "what was a hypothetical. Marlak gets right in Zed's face.
Enmebaragesi doesn't lie. Villagers gather around them, Maya and Eema among them. Marlak puts his spear point to Zed's throat. MARLAK (cont'd) The truth! Official White
Zed, just admit it. You're just making it harder on yourself.
(instantly annoyed) No, you just made it harder on myself! (to Marlak) Okay, fine, you got me. (gingerly moves the spear
Maya and I lay together on occasion. We're consenting adults and we have an adventurous sexual relationship. Maya looks shocked, and tries to signal Zed to shut up.
(STUNNED)
You laid with my woman?
Isn't that what we're talking about? Maya rolls her eyes.
No, I saw you eat the Forbidden Fruit.
Oh, that! Yeah! I did eat the fruit. I was just kidding about humping Maya. Marlak knocks Zed to the ground. The DRUMMING stops. Oh comes running over and gets between Marlak and Zed.
(FORCEFUL)
Hey! What's going on? Marlak growls at him.
(quickly looks up at the
Oooh, shooting star. Official White Zed gets to his feet.

Look, Marlak, this is crazy. You're two of me. I'm not gonna fight you over a girl, okay? Zed starts to walk away but quickly pivots and throws a W HAYMAKER at Marlak who easily ducks it, and it hits an unsuspecting Enmebaragesi squarely in the nose. Zed (to Enmebaragesi) And let that be a lesson to your big friend- Marlak grabs Zed, lands two solid punches to Zed's mid- section, and then clocks him with a vicious right that se him sprawling to the ground.
(standing over Zed) Your father was a great hunter, but you're like-- a girl. The hunters laugh.
Good one, Marlak.
Zing.
Now I kill you. He's about to spear Zed when suddenly the Shaman screams jumps between them. The villagers step back as the Shaman howls an incantation and shakes his magic rattle at Zed.
(leaning close to Zed) We need to talk.

7 Zed and the Shaman sit side by side on a log, talking privately. Official White The Shaman is covered in skins, feathers, bones, beads, animal teeth, antlers and horns, his hair a mass of long, muddy dreadlocks, his face painted, his cheeks, nose, and ears pierced by shards of bone. But if not for his outlandish getup, zed could be talking to his pastor.
You really ate the fruit?
One bite! What's the big deal?
(halfheartedly shakes a chicken-foot rattle at

You don't eat the fruit! That's been the number one rule from the beginning of time. Since the Great Turtle climbed from the sea with the Earth on his back, drank the ocean, pooped out the mountains and the first man fell from the stars.
I've always had trouble with the Great Turtle Theory-- too many unexplained gaps.
Whatever. You're screwed now.
Really? How screwed? Like I knew it was a rule but I'm a little fuzzy on the exact details.
You're cursed, man, and if you stay here then we'll all be cursed. You have to leave.
Where am I supposed to go?
Up to you. From now on you're completely on your own.
(DEFIANT)
Oh, really? (MORE)

Am I detecting a little jealousy here because I now have the knowledge of good and evil and you don't? Well, you know what? I say what I did was a good thing-- a very very good thing-- and I'm not leaving. What do you think of that? A HUMAN SKULL comes flying in from off-camera and lands a his feet.

Okay, is that supposed to be funny? He stands up and we see that the whole tribe is standing around them in a wide circle. Marlak bangs his spear on the edge of his animal-hide shi starting a rhythmical beat. The other hunters join in, keeping the beat, staring at Zed with lethal intent
(to Zed, re the hunters) You should probably get going now. You better take this knife. He hands him a flint knife with a leather-wrapped handle.
And some of the guys got together and they want you to have this bow. He hands him a strong hunter's bow.
I don't want to seem ungrateful or anything, but you wouldn't happen to have any arrows, would you? An arrow zips in and sticks in the post next to his head.
(to Zed) You'd better get moving. Zed looks around at his fellow villagers, trying to summo what dignity he has left.
(DEFIANT)
Okay, but before I go I just want to say something. I know I'm not the greatest hunter-- Official White
--Or gatherer--
Yes, or gatherer-- but there's got to be more to life than this-- (to Hunters) Kinda hard to concentrate with that rhythmic drumming, fellas. The Hunters keep the insistent beat, their gaze fixed on

(rolls his eyes; "these guys are hopeless") Anyways, I'm going away, not because you're forcing me to-- which you are-- but because I choose to. Yes, I ate from the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil-- major misunderstanding on my part-- and believe me I'm not recommending it unless you're interested in a very powerful laxative-- but it got me thinking about some pretty heavy stuff -- life questions, you know. So I'm out of here, and anyone who wants to join me is welcome. He looks around the circle and sees Maya. She sees Marlak staring at her and averts her eyes.
Zed looks at oh, who suddenly becomes very interested in imaginary piece of loincloth lint.
(looks directly at Oh) I don't know where we're going or when we're going to get there, but I will lead the way-- (he picks up a burning

lighting up the darkness-- pointing us in the right direction, and keeping us entertained with humorous anecdotes from my childhood. Now who's with me? He enthusiastically thrusts the torch in the air. Official White Oh looks at Eema, then at Zed, and lowers his eyes.
Okay, then I guess I'll just have to go it alone, which is fine with

(to Oh) --better, in fact, because having a partner would just slow me down. Oh can't look at him. Zed shakes his head, failing to notice that the torch he' holding has ignited the roof of the hut next to him. The Shaman shouts and points at the now blazing roof.
Oops! They all stare as the fire quickly leaps from roof to roo
I know there's a lesson in here somewhere. Any thoughts? The villagers scream and run off to try and save their hu It's chaos.
(raises his spear, to Zed) Now you die. Marlak throws his spear and misses as Zed takes off runni into the forest with the hunters right behind him and the whole village ablaze.

8 Zed runs for his life through the dense forest. The hunters chase him, shooting arrows at him on a dead r Zed dodges as the arrows zip around him. He veers left, t right, then trips and tumbles down a muddy embankment. The hunters stop at the top of the embankment. Marlak listens for sounds of movement in the forest below, then silently signals for the hunters to fan out. Official White Marlak nimbly makes his way down the embankment, reaches bottom and sees something in the moonlight. It's Zed lying on the ground, badly camouflaged with stic and leaves, thinking he can't be seen, but the shape of h body is clearly discernible. Marlak raises his spear.
I see you.
(long beat) No, you don't.
Yes, I do.
How can you see me if I'm not here?
You're trying to trick me.
Okay, then tell me this-- who's standing right behind you?

(nobody's fool) You think I'm going to turn around and look, but I'm not. (pulls his knife) I'm going to gut you like a pig. He is about to plunge his knife into Zed when suddenly he struck from behind by a heavy tree branch. He falls heavi knocked senseless by Oh who is standing over him with the makeshift club. Zed sits up and smiles gratefully at Oh.
I guess I'm with you.
Was it my speech?
No, the fire. I lost everything. Official White
But the speech was pretty good, right? I mean, even I was moved and I was the one speaking.
Can we talk about this later? Oh pulls Zed to his feet, and they sneak off into the dee woods.
9 CRICKETS. Zed and Oh walk through the moonlit forest.
This is nice, out here, the two of us.
(SULLEN)
Yeah, it's great.
Come on, those hunters are idiots. In an hour they'll forget the whole thing.
I don't think they'll forget the fire.

You know what we should do? You and me should kill the biggest boar ever-- just huge!-- and take it back to the village. Just to show them. And we won't let anyone else eat it. They'll have to watch us eat it.
If it's that huge how would we carry it back?
(CONSIDERING)
Fine, we'll just start with something small. A squirrel or something. Official White
Yeah, we'll make everyone watch us eat a squirrel. Will you get real? There's no going back! There's, nothing to go back to! It's just ashes.
(SCOFFS)
Yeah, like it's so hard to build a new hut. It's just a pile of sticks and dung--
(SCOWLS)
You're a pile of sticks and dung. Suddenly, Zed stops and stands perfectly still.
(through clenched teeth) Oh!
What are you doing? Zed makes a minimal gesture with his head. Oh looks up. A COUGAR crouches on a tree limb above them, poised to le Oh freezes. They talk like ventriloquists.
Don't move a muscle.
Will that work?
(without moving his lips) I don't know. There's two different opinions on this one. Some say run, some say don't.
What are you going to do?
I'm going to-- RUN! He sprints off and the cougar pounces right on oh.

Official White 10 Zed is holding a stick over the fire, cooking what looks a squirrel or a muskrat. Oh comes out of the forest carrying a huge armload of sti and branches. One of Oh's sticks falls, and as he careful reaches down to grab it, the rest spill out on the ground Oh sighs. His body is covered with long claw marks.
You really should put some maggots on those scratches. They look pretty deep.
(BITTER)
I just want to know why you told me not to move, and you ran.
Because I honestly thought he'd go for me. I thought I was doing you a favor. Apparently not appreciated.
Yeah, big favor.
You didn't have to come with me, you know. I didn't ask you to come.
Yes, you did! You looked right at me-- twice.

Yes, that's a technique of public speaking, but I didn't ask you specifically. You chose to come. You gotta take some responsibility for that. And there's no point coming if you're just gonna keep whining about every little-- cougar that attacks you. (pulls the cooked rodent from the fire) You want some or not? Official White
(HUFFY)
No, eat your weasel. You deserve it. He turns his back to Zed, and starts sorting through the of sticks.
You making your own fire?
No, arrows. We're going to need them.
(perks up) You're still coming?
(RESIGNED)
Yes. Zed claps him on the back and hugs him exuberantly. Oh winces in pain.
11 Zed and Oh are hiking uphill, the lush, dense verdure of forest now thinning to evergreens and mountain heather.
12 Zed and Oh climbing higher now. Finally, they reach the t and look out at the vista. From their vantage point they can see a high plateau and wooded land stretching far beyond it.
(GLOATING)
I knew it! Still think you're just gonna fall off the edge of the world? Official White

(in amazement) Incredible. He takes a step forward, the rock shelf gives way beneath feet and he falls a great distance, screaming all the way down, bouncing painfully off the big boulders, then a lon tumbling slide over sharp rocks and gravel to the bottom.
(WINCES)
Oooh. (then calls out) I'll go around! Wait for me!
13 Zed is following a trail downhill through the forest on t other side of the mountains. Oh is limping along behind h bitten, clawed, cut, scraped and bruised.
Say what you want, but that was no accident. You don't see a pattern here?
I see a pattern. Every time something terrible can happen to me, it does.
Yeah, but why? Why'd the cougar go for you and not me? Why did you fall and I didn't? Hard to believe it's all just random. Think about
looks around the forest clearing for subtle signs.
(sniffing the air) People-- more than one-- walking-- (he guesses) that way.
(looking around) You think? There's about a thousand footprints here. Official White He indicates the heavily trampled forest floor.
(ignores him) Yes! There! He drops to one knee and examines something in the bushes Zed They stopped here to poop. Look.
No, thank you.
Four men, maybe five. And a child-- or a small women maybe.
(a little disgusted) Okay.
(poking at the evidence) Looks like they had some nuts-- dried fruit-- some kind of green leafy vegetable--

Okay! Enough! Can we just go? Maybe we can find where they peed. 14 stealthily to the tree line. Oh creeps up beside him and they peer through the bushes. THREE COWS are grazing in a green pasture. Beyond it, wel tended fields of growing grain. Zed snaps into stalking mode, ducks down and silently sig Oh to be quiet and stay put.
(WHISPERS)

This one's mine. He takes his bow, pulls an arrow from his quiver, and slo draws the bow, taking deadly aim at one of the cows. He shoots. The blunt, pointless arrow hits the cow in the side and bounces off. The cow looks up.

(to Oh) We're gonna need some arrowheads. Zed draws his flint knife, then suddenly bursts out of th forest, dashes toward the cow and leaps on its back. Oh comes running up as the cow bucks and sends Zed flying Lying on the ground, Zed looks up and sees TWO SURPRISED YOUNG FARMERS dressed in simple white woolen tunics stari at him.
Did you just shoot my cow?
(getting painfully to his
Yeah, well-- we're hunters.
(covering for himself) He's a hunter. I'm more of a "maker." I made this loincloth, I do arrows-- I made a shelf unit for my hut--
What do you guys do?
What does it look like? We're farmers.
He's a farmer; I'm a herdsman.
You're a suck, is what you are.
(ignores him) My brother, Cain. I am called Abel.
You are called suck.
My brother is angry because God looked on my sacrifice with favor. Official White                                  28.
(mimics him) "God looked on my sacrifice with
(to Oh) Okay, is he a total suck or what?
Well, it's hard to say-- we just
Why are you dragging them into this? What do they know? They're morons.
(OFFENDED)
Hey! Easy!
(to Abel) You think you're so superior to everyone else.
Superior-er than you.
Really? Let's see how good you are at getting your ass kicked. (shoves him)
Yeah? Bring it! (shoves him back)
Okay, boys, that's enough. We just want to--
(won't let it go) No! This smug asshole insulted you and I want him to take it back.
We're not really that insulted--
(pushes Abel hard) Take it back! Official White
(pushes back) Make me! Zed steps between them, trying to make peace.

Boys, boys! You're brothers! Let's just relax and-- Cain uses the distraction to sneak-punch Abel and the fig is on. They start throwing wild punches, then clinch and wrestle each other to the ground.
Shouldn't we do something?

Just let them settle it. Cain picks up a good-size rock and strikes Abel on the he with all his might. Abel falls heavily to the ground and lies there, not moving. Cain stands over him, breathing hard.
(SHOCKED)
I guess that settles it.
(turns on him sharply, still holding the bloody
What?!
Nothing! Cain stares at Abel, still inert on the ground.
He's all right. Probably just
(humoring him) Probably just tuckered out from the fight.
(looking around nervously) Yeah. (MORE)

CAIN                                       (cont'd) Maybe I should throw some dirt on him-- keep him warm 'til he wakes up. He starts kicking dirt over Abel's body. CAIN                                       (cont'd) (getting worried) This is bad. This is really bad. We're in serious trouble.
Hey! What do you mean "we"? I don't want to play the blame game, but you're the one who hit him.
(turns on them) You could've stopped me! There's two of you and only one of me.
We didn't know you were going to kill him--
You calling me a murderer? (he clutches the rock)
Did I say that?
It was an accident! (to Oh) Right?
Right! You were holding the rock and he-- accidentally ran into it-- really hard-- with his head.
(calming down) Okay-- yeah-- good. But it might be better if we don't mention the "accident" to anyone. People might get the wrong idea. Understand?
Oh, yeah, people could so easily misinterpret that. Official White
(SHRUGS)
Why even bring it up?
(NODS)
I like you guys. You're all right. Why don't you come with me? Have supper with the family.
Unfortunately we already have dinner plans.
I think you should come with me.
(his idea) why don't we go with you?
15 Cain finishes loading bushels of grain onto an oxcart whi Zed and Oh closely inspect the big, heavy, solid wooden wheels on the cart.
What are the big round things for?
They're wheels, numbskull. They make the cart roll.
(blown away) Wow! That is like the greatest invention since the vagina. Cain whips the oxen and they lumber forward. Oh screams as the HEAVY WHEELS ROLL OVER HIS FEET.
16 They look really thrilled, wind blowing through their hai their hands up like roller-coaster riders. Official White
(WHOOPING)
Woooo! Woooo! Yeah!

with them riding on it, plodding slowly into a FARMING HAMLET,Aa cluster of small, roughly plastered mud houses thatched roofs. ADAM, dour, hard-working and long-suffering, but still st and upright, trudges home with a metal scythe over his shoulder. He could be Max Von Sydow.
(hailing Cain) Cain, my son!
Hail, Father. Cain stops the cart and dismounts with Zed and Oh.
Can these guys stay for supper? (off Adam's questioning
I bring strangers who would sojourn with us this night. Cain turns to Zed and Oh and furtively mimes an elaborate sewing gesture, ancient precursor to the modern lip-zippe
Greetings, strangers. I am called Adam and you are welcome to share the fruits of our toil.
Thanks, but I'm kind of staying away from fruit for the time being. Zed gives Cain a subtle, acquiescent nod as Adam ushers t into his crude dwelling.

Official White 17 17 The rude dwelling has a stark, somber, almost Amish feeli to it. Zed and Oh sit at the table sharing a simple meal with Adam, Cain and his Adam's wife EVE and h them, Lilith's tunic gaping open to reveal her breasts ev time she leans over to put something on the table. Zed an Oh can't take their eyes off her.
(to Cain) Where is thy brother, Abel?
(badly overplaying) Abel? Haven't seen him. I thought he was with you. (to Zed and Oh) You guys see him? They shake their heads and cough nervously.
(equally unconvincing) Nape. Not that I remember. Never seen anybody-- anywhere-- anytime -- ever.
(to Cain) Your sister Lilith said she saw him in the field with you.
I think that was yesterday.
No, this day. She said you both made offerings.
That might've been Boaz---
No, you and Abel. She said it looked like you were arguing.
Hey, we're brothers, we argue sometimes- it's not that big a deal. Official White
And his flock was untended in the
(EXPLODES)
Okay! What am I-- his keeper? Get off my back, will you? He smashes his plate against the wall and storms out. An awkward silence as Zed and Oh exchange guilty looks.
I fear the worst for Abel. I am sorely vexed.
Yeah, that's got to be pretty vexing. A Bergmanesque gloom fills the hovel as Adam muses sullen on his sorry circumstances.

For my sin the ground is cursed. Thorns and thistles does it sprout for us, and we are doomed to toil all the days of our lives. For as the Lord has commanded, by the sweat of your brow shall you get bread to eat until you return to the ground from which you were taken. For dust you are, and to dust shall you return.
Wow. That's kind of a downer isn't it?
It's the way of the world.
Boy, I hope not.
(rises abruptly) You are welcome to stay the night and lay with my daughter Lilith. Zed looks at the luscious Lilith, then back at Adam. Official White
I'm waiting for the punchline.
She is without a husband, and as the Lord has said, thou shalt be fruitful and multiply. Lilith nods demurely and exits through a curtain. Zed sta to follow her out.
Hey! What about me?
You may share the bed of my son Seth.
Yeah, there you go. (he exits) Oh looks at Seth.
I multiplied with a sheep. (Oh just stares at him) My thingie smells like lamb chops. 18 Zed enters the room. Lilith reclines on a cot with a stra mattress.
(making room on the cot) My bed is small but you're welcome to share it. It's the way of my people.
(lying down beside her) And that's a good way to be. In fact, I'm kind of surprised a pretty girl like you is sleeping alone anyway. I would've thought guys would be lined up at the door.
I don't like men. Official White
(moving closer) Maybe you just haven't met the right one.
I like girls.
(SUAVE)
So we have that in common--
(stares at him for a beat) I'm attracted to women.
(a beat) I don't even know what that means. What does that mean?
I like to have sex with other women.
(stares at her for a long

I'm really not getting this. Lilith shakes her head, turns away from him, and pulls up blanket. Zed shrugs and rolls over to sleep. They lie the quietly in the dark for a long beat. Then-- Zed You're kidding! Whoa! That's amazing! 19 Oh is lying next to Seth, wide-awake, trying to stay as f away from him as possible.
Oooh, listen to this one. Seth lifts his knees to his chest and farts a surprisingl long cadenza.
That's really good. Official White
Want to see a trick?
Do I have to?
20 In the yard behind the house, Oh is helping Cain as he ch firewood with a metal axe. Oh now wears a tunic like the farmers.
It's been the same damn thing my whole life. (swings the axe-- thwack!) "Why can't you be more like Abel?" (thwack!) "Oh, your sacrifice was good, too, but Abel's was-- wow!" (thwack!)
(trying to change the
Your brother Seth is an interesting guy. Did you know he can put his penis in his mouth? Adam and Zed come out of his dwelling. KINSMEN from other dwellings start gathering.
Cain!
Yeah, hey-- where's everybody going?
To look for Abel.
(MUTTERS)
Good luck.
What did you say? Official White
(louder, mock sincerity) I said good luck. I'm really worried about him. He turns aside and makes a goofy sarcastic face for Oh's benefit.
You're not coming?
Yeah, I am. I just have to finish toiling over here, then I'm right behind you. Adam and the others hurry off, and as soon as they're gon Cain rushes over and starts harnessing the oxen to the ca
(to Zed and Oh) Now listen, I'm getting out of here, and you better come with me. I have a feeling they're going to try and blame this whole "Abel- killing-thing" on you.
Why would they blame us?

Because when they find him and his head is all bashed in, they're going to start pointing fingers, and you guys are drifters, so they'll put two and two together and that makes-- He stares expectantly at Zed and Oh.
Four! It makes four! Now stop asking so many questions and hop on. We gotta get out of here! He urgently whips the oxen and they climb aboard as the c lumbers forward.
21 21 Adam and the other farmers discover Abel's body.
(BITTERLY)
(to the others) After him! The farmers shout and race back to the hamlet.
22 22 Adam and the other farmers jump onto two more oxcarts and out after Cain, Zed and Oh.
23 Cain's cart lumbers along. He looks back over his shoulde
(urgently, to Zed and Oh) They're gaining on us! Zed and Oh look back.
The other oxcarts are a hundred yards back, "chasing" the maybe two miles per hour. Cain whips his oxen and they step up the pace to 3 MPH.
(GLEEFUL)

Hah! They'll never catch us now! An aerial view shows Cain's cart slowly pulling away from pursuers. Suddenly a bolt of lightning splits the bright blue sky a strikes Cain right on the forehead, knocking him back int the cart. He sits up stunned, with a still-smoking, jagge burn mark on his forehead. Official White
(dazed but exhilarated) Wow! What are the odds of that?! (feeling the burn mark) Am I lucky or what? Zed and Oh exchange doubtful looks and glance nervously a the sky.

24 The ox cart approaches a small trading settlement on the seacoast, a kind of makeshift tent city around a central marketplace. Several dhows are tied up at the shore, came and pack animals are tethered on the fringes, while TRADE and MERCHANTS inspect newly arrived goods and haggle over prices. 25 Zed, Oh and Cain wander through the crowded market. PEOPL OF EVERY RACE dressed in all manner of exotic garb buy, s and barter goods from distant lands. Zed and oh gawk like couple of yokels.
Look at all these people! And this stuff! Oh approaches a bakery stand and stares hungrily at the bread.
(to the Merchant) Can I have one of those? He reaches for a loaf but the MERCHANT strikes his hand w a cane.
Ow!
Two silver pieces.
(HUNGRY)
We're gonna need some money. Official White

Yeah, we're gonna need money. (an afterthought) What's money? They see a crowd at the center of the market gathered aro a raised platform. SLAVES IN SHACKLES are lined up on the raised wooden plat while CUSTOMERS examine those waiting to be auctioned. The AUCTIONEER brings up a fnuscular male slave in a loincloth.
It's Marlak! Marlak's hands are bound and he's restrained by a chain attached to a thick leather collar around his neck.

(addresses the crowd) Next up, an unusual item-- looks like a Caucasian-- he's big, he's strong, he's a good breeder, so I'm going to start at Do I hear As the bidding starts, Zed spots Maya, his sister Eema, a Enmebaragesi among the chained-up slaves waiting to be so Zed and Oh push their way through the crowd and go to the
(amazed to see them) Eema! Maya! The women embrace him with relief and excitement.
(SHEEPISH)
Hi, Eema.
Oh.
What happened? How did you get here? Official white

Well, after the fire-- (she shoots him an accusing look)) --the hill tribes raided the village. The men fought them but they were too many. They took us captive, marched us to the sea, then traded us to the boat people who brought us here.
(to Eema) Are you all right? Did they-- rape you?
(SHRUGS)
Just a little. Zed and Oh look at her curiously. The SLAVE TRADER sees them talking to Eema and approaches
You interested in some slaves?

(like a prospective buyer) Yeah, this one looks pretty good-- He starts prodding, poking and squeezing Maya's arm like buying fruit. Oh takes the opportunity to fondle Eema's breasts. She punches him. Zed Ooh, feisty! So how does this work if we want them? The slave trader notes Zed's peasant clothes.
You have money?
